text: <@U0KPFAZNF> <@U0KM61BCP> <@U0PB67X4K> one other thing <@U0KN2SSKE> reminded me off… need instructions/resrictions  running peer and chaincode in the merged branch. Its same as the old convergence but would be needed for people moving in from master
Hey <@U0ULK2JPP> not quite sure what you mean.  Can you elaborate
<@U0KPFAZNF> Sure. so I’m assuming very few people are using convergence branch today as they use master
Ok I think I got you
When we merge out to master, we need to make sure people know how to use it
right
Got it, and agree
and also point them to alternative (v0.6 ?) if they want to continue pre-v1.0 ways
This first CR will only mod convergence
ok
We will get them synchronized and then decide when to merge back out
ok
so after we get everthing we need from master, we will stop patches there ?
I would guess we will merge convergence out to master soon and get rid of convergence
Is that what you meant?
ok.  I understand now
I thought there may be a period of time there will be both master and merged convergence
but if that’s a transient and short then we don’t have to worry about new requests coming to master
personally I dont think we need to worry about it either way…at least not from the perspective of the patches themselves
it will be relatively straight forward to merge any new patches added
the biggest question is, are there people who intentionally want whats in master now?
e.g. not convergence and not v0.6
thats what would go away
but the difference between v0.6 and master is small, so I would imagine that the vast majority of those cases could simply fall back to v0.6
on a related note: we could consider merging whats in master now to v0.6 for inclusion in a future v0.6.2+
<@U0ULK2JPP> did you ever try to level-set your setup to see if you could reproduce those go-vet failures?
that is super odd

<@U0KPFAZNF|ghaskins> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/ghaskins/F2QSD6LBU/-.m|Untitled> and commented: <@U0ULK2JPP> also, i am consistently getting this error now for some reason

file.title: Untitled

initial_comment.comment: <@U0ULK2JPP> also, i am consistently getting this error now for some reason

text: not sure why
actually I should…
I saw that too
but when I ran it again it worked
lets check with <@U0XPR4NP4>
<@U0ULK2JPP> I've seen non-determinism in that test before, I assume this is for 0.6 (since this code is going away in v1?)
<@U0XPR4NP4> this is covergence-merged-with-master
right
this is going away
but want to make sure merge itself is good
ie, if it didn’t happen in convergence, and didn’t happen in master, why would it in convergence-merged-with-master
My best guess is that it's a non-deterministic timing thing, but obviously would need to review the actual changes to say so with more confidence
<@U0KPFAZNF> `make unit-test` did run for me … does it always fail for you ?
twice in a row
not exactly scientific, but ill try again
first was on the “merge” commit, and the second was on our original patch sequence
would you like me to pull your changes and try ?
both diff to the same tree, but I was sanity checking since I knew the patch sequence version passed earlier
sure, let me just push it to gerrit and we can work from that
ok
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1839/>
thanks… pulling it

<@U0UGH3X7X> <@U0XPR4NP4> <@U0XQ35CDD> after master->convergence in <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1839/>  unit-test is consistently failing in consensus <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/job/fabric-verify-x86_64/1861/consoleFull>
can you take a look pretty please ?
its fails sporadically in dev env (but usually runs once in 2 or 3 times)

<@U0ULK2JPP> I'm not seeing any files touched in this changeset in the consensus package (other than simplebft, which should be unrelated).  This points even more strongly to this test being timing dependent, with this changeset simply modifying the test timing.
thanks <@U0XPR4NP4> that’s our feeling too….
I can try to figure out exactly why this test is failing, but I don't think it's related to your changeset
just FYI, the reverify went thru it
adding strength to the above assessment
<@U0KPFAZNF> the CI verification just completed successfully
cool
and thanks for the assist <@U0XPR4NP4>
we’ve been scratching our heads on this one
<@U0KPFAZNF> Wish it were more of an assist than "Yep, it was broken when you found it", but glad to help
well, sometimes just an authoritative answer is all that is needed :wink:
rather than “what did we screw up"
<@U0ULK2JPP> <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1jj-gsIsfDGa2b3Z08-Zw69IICGZHPB18OufttatK1P8/edit?usp=sharing>
that helps quite some for next steps with unresolved patches
yeah, even if we can get a y/n on each of those, extremely helpful
and it nice that it falls into two clean categories - bdd and java support
<@U1M7K67EV> and <@U0YNFB22X>  could you look at the left overs from the master -> convergence branch merge (where we couldn’t resolve conflicts cleanly) please ?
<@U1M7K67EV|jcarrivick> has joined the channel
<@U0YNFB22X|satheesh> has joined the channel
<@U1M7K67EV> <@U0YNFB22X> see the spreadsheet link above
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1jj-gsIsfDGa2b3Z08-Zw69IICGZHPB18OufttatK1P8/edit?usp=sharing>
CR 1839 (<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1839/>) merges master -> convergence, but we skipped those
some might not be applicable, some might need porting
please do the work relative to 1839 though, if you would be so kind to assist
do note that those patches will effectively be dropped in convergence, and eventually master, unless you take action
please at least acknowledge that you read the above ^^^ line <@U1M7K67EV> <@U0YNFB22X>
after 1839 commits, git will consider the merge complete (including the decision to skip the 10 patches mentioned)
so, unless they are explicitly handled such as with a cherry-pick, they will cease to be part of the code base
<@U0ULK2JPP> <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1839/>
build passed
yes!
twice in a row
of course, I still have the [WIP] in there, heh
haha
let’s remove that while the going is good
ok
given all the checks and cross checks, I feel pretty good about this. what do you think ?
i feel good about it, yes
just pushed the removal of WIP
ok
also have a chaintool PR for your review in the other channel
after this, ill make a pass with v0.6->master, and then one last master->convergence
(as separate steps from 1839, that is)
id like 1839 to go in ASAP
where is everyone today?
the channel is so quiet

<@U0KPFAZNF> acknowledged.
Sorry, I haven't been working on hyperledger for a bit. Just to clarify, I need to cherry pick the commits in the spreadsheet onto 1839?
or onto feature/convergence
1839 is a superset of feature/convergence…it will probably go smoother if you target that
(it depends on whether you based on anything earlier in master)
and yes, if you could look at those 7 commits you authored for master, figure out if they are still applicable, and if so, cherry-pick them on top of 1839, that would be fantastic
thank you
alternately, we could do this post merge ? would that be better?
All the commits on that list under my name are for the BDD tests
So I guess they could be skipped if the BDD tests are going to be abandoned
Unfortuanetly, they aren't really independent commits (many inter dependencies) so it could be quite time consuming for me to merge them
in any case BDD tests will have to change given that we are under a different model in v1.0
In that case, is there any point in me porting these changes over?
I'm happy to spend some time to do so. I'd just like it to be a useful action to take.
I too would like to avoid wasted effort but don’t know enough to know how much can be reused... Perhaps revisit this once dust has settled down ?
<@U0ULK2JPP> I agree, I think it might be best to tackle the bdd tests stuff after the merge has occured
thank you for that..  I wish the patches had gone through without conflicts.
<@U0KPFAZNF> <@U0ULK2JPP> do I need to submit those the patches again to the convergence branch, or modify this patch you mentioned ? What do you guys suggest ?
